Setup Crossdomain

  • ../1-Setup

PreConditions

  1. You have installed XSockets.
  2. If you are NOT using the XSocketHandler project that is installed with XSockets
    • See to it that the assembly get copied to the pluginfolder (see XSocketHandler postbuild events)

The Configuration

Crossdomain is really all about configuration. If you look at the configurationfile you can see that we have a key called XSocketServerOrigin. The value of this key is all hosts allowed to connect to the server.

Example

  1. This configuration will allow connections from http://xsockets.net, http://asp.net and http://127.0.0.1 
    <add key="XSocketServerOrigin" value="http://xsockets.net,http://asp.net,http://127.0.0.1" />
    To test this you can setup up fake hosts in your hosts.txt file under C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc
